text: Fort Theater is a historic two-story building in Kearney, Nebraska. It was built in 1914 as The Empress by F.G. Keens, and designed in the Classical Revival style. With After it was partly destroyed in 1940, it was purchased by Don and George Monroe, who added a marquee to the facade; it was designed in the Moderne style by architect Edward J. Sessinghaus. Inside, there are murals by Joyce Ballantyne. The building has been listed on the National Register of Historic Places since July 12, 2006. ==References== Category:National Register of Historic Places in Buffalo County, Nebraska Category:Neoclassical architecture in Nebraska Category:Moderne architecture in the United States Category:Buildings and structures completed in 1914 Category:1914 establishments in Nebraska
title: Fort Theater
